binop/lit16

Purpose

Perform the indicated binary op on the indicated register (first argument) and literal value (second argument), storing the result in the destination register.

Details

Op & Format Mnemonic / Syntax Arguments
d0..d7 22s binop/lit16 vA, vB, #+CCCC
d0: add-int/lit16
d1: rsub-int (reverse subtract)
d2: mul-int/lit16
d3: div-int/lit16
d4: rem-int/lit16
d5: and-int/lit16
d6: or-int/lit16
d7: xor-int/lit16 		A: destination register (4 bits)
B: source register (4 bits)
C: signed int constant (16 bits)

Constraints

  • Both A and B must be valid register indices in the current stackframe.
  • Registers vA and vB must be defined. They must both contain integer values.
  • C is an immediate, signed integer constant taken from the instruction stream (actually this means there are no special requirements for C at all).

Behavior

  • The given operation <binop> is performed according to the semantics specified in table XXX.
  • Argument C is sign-extended to 32 bits before.
  • The result is stored in register vA, that is, vA'=vB <binop> vC.
  • As usual, neighboring registers might get undefined, if vA was part of a register pair originally.

Exceptions

  • ArithmeticException if an error occurs during the instruction.
